result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mercedez Elaine Randle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
-NO FILE IN COURT

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Status Conference to see if the defendant did in fact turn herself in by today.
Atty. Danielle Shelton filed with the Court a copy of the defendant's Harris County case that showed the defendant did turn herself in and ultimately posted bail.
Statements made.
State moves to administratively close this case.
No objections.
Upon stipulation of the parties, Court "administratively" closed this case.

**The cash bail on deposit can be refunded to whomever posted it.

14RM010158  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/21/14 vf

Court REQUIRES defendant to post bail in the amount of $500.00 cash with the following conditions of release:  Defendant is to turn herself in to Harris County authorities in Houston, Texas ON HER OWN ACCORD by March 7, 2014.
Failure to do so will result in the defendant having an open warrant in Wisconsin and Texas.

Defendant Mercedez Elaine Randle in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Mercedez Elaine Randle IN CUSTODY.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant has an open warrant in Texas with an extradition order.
Statements made.
Defendant signed a waiver of extradition.
Court ACCEPTS defendant's waiver of extradition.
Court REQUIRES defendant to post bail in the amount of $500.00 cash with the following conditions of release:  Defendant is to turn herself in to Harris County authorities in Houston, Texas ON HER OWN ACCORD by March 7, 2014.
Failure to do so will result in the defendant having an open warrant in Wisconsin and Texas.
Court wants to see if defendant complies with this court order.
Court schedules this matter for a Status Conference on 03-07-2014 at 8:30 AM - Intake Court.
**Court CANCELLED the 02-26-2014 at 8:30 AM Scheduling Conference before Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, signed Waiver of Extradition.

Atty. Danielle Shelton appeared in person today in Judge Donald's Court to request a bail hearing before 02-26-2014.  Clerk conferred with the Court and her request is approved.
Case adjourned to 02-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Bail/Bond Hearing.

Defendant Mercedez Elaine Randle in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Mercedez Elaine Randle in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of TEXAS.  Defendant asked for Waiver, but with revision to waiver language.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 2.

ADDRESS INFO for Mercedez Elaine Randle
Current: 9165 Imogene Street, Houston, TX 77036 United States  (Effective: 02-20-2014)
Prior: 3947 N 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Mercedez Elaine Randle in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Mercedez Elaine Randle in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Initial Appearance this date.  Attorney Shelton requests this matter be adjourned as hold may be lifted in Houston as Defendant's Mother may be posting bail.  Court grants request.  Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
